rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELREC.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Study Identifier of the domain record(s).
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELREC.RDOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: 2-character abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s).
datasetVariables.label: Related Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: RDOMAIN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELREC.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELREC.APID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier for a single associated person, a group of associated persons, or a pool of associated persons. If APID identifies a pool, POOLDEF records must exist for each associated person (see Section 4.1.3, Pool Definition Dataset and Section 6.2, Associated Persons Relationships).
datasetVariables.label: Associated Persons Identifier
datasetVariables.name: APID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELREC.POOLID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used for pooling subjects to assign a single finding to multiple subjects.
datasetVariables.label: Pool Identifier
datasetVariables.name: POOLID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELREC.IDVAR

datasetVariables.description: Name of the identifying variable in the general-observation-class dataset that identifies the related record(s). Examples: --SEQ and --GRPID.
datasetVariables.label: Identifying Variable
datasetVariables.name: IDVAR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELREC.IDVARVAL

datasetVariables.description: Value of identifying variable described in IDVAR. If --SEQ is the variable being used to describe this record, then the value of --SEQ is entered here.
datasetVariables.label: Identifying Variable Value
datasetVariables.name: IDVARVAL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELREC.RELTYPE

datasetVariables.description: Identifies the hierarchical level of the records in the relationship. Values should be either ONE or MANY. However, values are only necessary when identifying a relationship between datasets.
datasetVariables.label: Relationship Type
datasetVariables.name: RELTYPE

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELREC.RELID

datasetVariables.description: RELID value should be unique within the ID variable (e.g., USUBJID, APID, POOLID, SPDEVID) that is the subject of the relationship. All records with this ID variable that have the same RELID are considered "related/associated." RELID can be any value the sponsor chooses, and is only meaningful within the RELREC dataset to identify the related/associated Domain records.
datasetVariables.label: Relationship Identifier
datasetVariables.name: RELID

datasets.description: A dataset used to describe relationships between records for a subject within or across domains, and relationships of records across datasets. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C147182, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Related Records
datasets.name: RELREC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable SUPPQUAL.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Study Identifier of the parent record(s).
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable SUPPQUAL.RDOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: 2-character abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s).
datasetVariables.label: Related Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: RDOMAIN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable SUPPQUAL.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable SUPPQUAL.APID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier for a single associated person, a group of associated persons, or a pool of associated persons. If APID identifies a pool, POOLDEF records must exist for each associated person (see Section 4.1.3, Pool Definition Dataset and Section 6.2, Associated Persons Relationships).
datasetVariables.label: Associated Persons Identifier
datasetVariables.name: APID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable SUPPQUAL.POOLID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used for pooling subjects to assign a single finding to multiple subjects.
datasetVariables.label: Pool Identifier
datasetVariables.name: POOLID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable SUPPQUAL.IDVAR

datasetVariables.description: Identifying variable in the parent dataset that identifies the related record(s). Examples: --SEQ, --GRPID.
datasetVariables.label: Identifying Variable
datasetVariables.name: IDVAR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable SUPPQUAL.IDVARVAL

datasetVariables.description: Value of identifying variable of the parent record(s).
datasetVariables.label: Identifying Variable Value
datasetVariables.name: IDVARVAL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable SUPPQUAL.QNAM

datasetVariables.description: The short name of the Qualifier variable, which is used as a column name in a domain view with data from the parent domain. The value in QNAM cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST"). QNAM cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. This will often be the column name in the sponsor's operational dataset. QNAM should not be the name of any standard ADaM variable.
datasetVariables.label: Qualifier Variable Name
datasetVariables.name: QNAM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable SUPPQUAL.QLABEL

datasetVariables.description: This is the long name or label associated with QNAM. The value in QLABEL cannot be longer than 40 characters. This will often be the column label in the sponsor's original dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Qualifier Variable Label
datasetVariables.name: QLABEL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable SUPPQUAL.QVAL

datasetVariables.description: Result of, response to, or value associated with QNAM. A value for this column is required; no records can be in a SUPP-- dataset with a null value for QVAL.
datasetVariables.label: Data Value
datasetVariables.name: QVAL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable SUPPQUAL.QORIG

datasetVariables.description: Because QVAL can represent a mixture of collected (on a CRF), derived, or assigned items, QORIG is used to indicate the origin of this data. Examples: CRF, ASSIGNED, DERIVED.
datasetVariables.label: Origin
datasetVariables.name: QORIG

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable SUPPQUAL.QEVAL

datasetVariables.description: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain objectively collected or derived data. Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "STATISTICIAN", "DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR", "CLINICAL COORDINATOR".
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: QEVAL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable POOLDEF.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Study Identifier of the parent record(s).
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable POOLDEF.POOLID

datasetVariables.description: An identifier used to identify a result from a group of subjects that is not assignable to a specific subject.
datasetVariables.label: Pool Identifier
datasetVariables.name: POOLID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable POOLDEF.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable POOLDEF.APID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier for a single associated person, a group of associated persons, or a pool of associated persons.
datasetVariables.label: Associated Persons Identifier
datasetVariables.name: APID

datasets.description: A dataset that identifies individual subjects included in a pool of subjects for which a single observation record (pool level) is captured. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C147181, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Pooled Definition
datasets.name: POOLDEF

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELSUB.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELSUB.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. Either USUBJID or POOLID must be populated.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELSUB.POOLID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to identify a pool of subjects. If POOLID is entered, POOLDEF records must exist for each subject in the pool and USUBJID must be null. Either USUBJID or POOLID must be populated.
datasetVariables.label: Pool Identifier
datasetVariables.name: POOLID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELSUB.RSUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to identify a related subject or pool of subjects. RSUBJID will be populated with either the USUBJID of the related subject or the POOLID of the related pool.
datasetVariables.label: Related Subject or Pool Identifier
datasetVariables.name: RSUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable RELSUB.SREL

datasetVariables.description: Describes the relationship of the subject identified in USUBJID or the pool identified in POOLID to the subject or pool identified in RSUBJID.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Relationship
datasetVariables.name: SREL

datasets.description: A dataset used to represent relationships between study subjects. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C147183, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Related Subjects
datasets.name: RELSUB

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DR.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Study Identifier of the domain record(s).
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DR.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: 2-character abbreviation for the domain, which must be "DR".
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DR.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable DR.SPDEVID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for the device. It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, combination of identifiers) as defined in DI.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SPDEVID

datasets.description: A special-purpose domain that contains the linkage of each subject to the device(s) to which they may have been exposed during the study. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102620, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Device-Subject Relationships
datasets.name: DR

description: This SDTM class provides a means to link related records between datasets. It includes the RELREC and SUPPQUAL datasets. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103376, 2018-06-29)
label: Relationship Datasets
name: Relationship
